abstract: Partisan mistrust permeates Congressional budget spat over funding fight against quickly-spreading Zika virus; Republicans are fretting over whether money targeting potential epidemic could end up funding abortions or increased contraception use, while Democrats are anguishing over potential environmental impact from pesticides used on Zika-bearing mosquitoes.
lead_paragraph: While Republicans worry about applying tax dollars to abortion or encouraging contraception, Democrats fear a backdoor assault on environmental regulations.

headline.main: Political Battles Color Congressional Feud Over Zika Funding
headline.print_headline: Partisan Mistrust Adds Complexity to Congressional Feuding Over Zika

snippet: While Republicans worry about applying tax dollars to abortion or encouraging contraception, Democrats fear a backdoor assault on environmental regulations.
